html:
Chapter 7:  The Way Back Home






“-I must be fucking mishearing you,” Sklav snarled into his phone, “The payment didn’t come through?” He paced back and forth in the warehouse, “No, no it was SCHEDULED for NOW. Winstone’s payments always clear, that’s part of our deal.”

He stopped, “Bull. Fucking. Shit. Nothing’s wrong. I even sold him that whore he wanted. Now you call him on his phone, you ask him where my fucking money is, and you remind him that we had an arrangement. Do you-”

???
“Wilson Sklav?” A voice called.

Sklav
Sklav felt his blood chill.
He stiffened and slowly turned.  “...Get it done, I’ll call you back,” he hung up his phone and shoved it into his pocket.

???
Walking across the warehouse towards him, flanked by two men in body armor, was a man. His skin was pale, his eyes an ashen grey, his hair jet black. He wore a suit with a long tie, which he reached up to straighten with a gloved hand. 

He smiled at Sklav, but the smile was empty. Cold.

“Or should I call you, Willis Kaplan. Associate of Bernard Hollis, or Knebeln as he was calling himself. Kenebln and Sklav? Gag and Slave? Did you think that was clever?”

Sklav
“You…” Sklav took a shuddering breath, “...You’re the Gentleman. Aren’t you?”

The Gentleman
The Gentleman’s smile spread wider, “Good. We’ve gotten introductions out of the way."
"Now we can get to business.”

Sklav
Sklav’s mouth opened and closed,
“B-business! Yeah! Business. We ah. Business is fine. Aside from Knebeln’s… Situation, things are going smoothly.”

The Gentleman
“Smooth is hardly what I’d call it,” The Gentleman drawled.

“You kidnapped a girl, and hours later your office was raided by Firebrand. You sold her to Anderson Winstone in a hurry and just last night she ended up gone from his care.”

His eyes narrowed. “None of which I was made aware of, I will add.”

Sklav
“I…” Sklav tried to smile, “I uh… I thought Winstone was going to tell you. I told him to put a good word in with you-”

The Gentleman
“Anderson and I aren’t on ‘good word’ terms,” The Gentleman interjected, “I didn’t get any of this from him.”

He looked around the room.
“...Mister Sklav..."
"...do you know what this whole situation reeks of? The raid by Firebrand on your associate. Knebeln’s capture. A hastily handled sale, and then a few months later the sale just disappears..."  

"... and NONE of it REPORTED back to me….”

He turned his eyes back to Sklav.
“I have three rules."
"You pay your tithes."
"You don’t piss in my sandbox."
"And you don’t shit where I eat."

"And Mister Sklav… This whole situation REEKS of shit.”

Sklav
Sklav felt his stomach twist itself into a knot. Like a rag being rung out.

The Gentleman
“...It’s one of my least favorite things, Sklav,” The Gentleman snapped his fingers and his guards began to circle to either side of Sklav, “A liability.”

Sklav
"Listen..." Sklav said, "Knebeln... H-he can be replaced. We can make this work, especially with your network, your resources," he clasped his hands together in front of him, "I can make you millions, Gentleman. I can open supply lines. I can-"

The Gentleman
"-The amount I spent plugging every hole, tying every knot, and ensuring you're no longer compromised as a liability?"
"Any profit you could provide wouldn't be worth the trouble."

He stepped closer.

"What's more, Sklav. It would send a message. That failures are rewarded. That they get a second chance."

He spread his hands as his pupils shrank to pinpricks.
"Do you think I can afford to send that message?"

Sklav
Sklav backed away, looking nervously at the two frightening men circling closer.

"I... I can... I can be useful. I'm not like Knebeln, I promise."

The Gentleman
The Gentleman snapped his fingers, "Ernst, Sloane."

The men lunged in, grabbed Sklav by the arms, and held him in place as the Gentleman slowly strode closer.

Sklav
"Please!" Sklav cried, "Please, I-I know I can be valuable to you! Don't do this!"

The Gentleman
"Shh...." The Gentleman soothed him as he drew a knife from his coat, "You can be valuable. You're absolutely right. And as I was saying, there's nothing quite so valuable..." He brought the knife closer and closer to Sklav's face.

"...As sending a message."



+++

The doors blew in.

Several men in masks swept the warehouse, swinging rifles left and right. As they passed, the girls hid away in the shadows of their cages, watching them pass by with wide, wild eyes.

Walking through the center of the men, a coat flowing behind them and protective helmet obscuring their face, was the leader of the vigilante group that shared their name.

Firebrand.

Firebrand
They held their handgun raised, taking in the location.
then after a moment, they relaxed their gun.
"Clear!"

Vigilante
"Clear!"  Was called back.

Firebrand
But then they stopped, holding up their hand
"....Wait."

They stared at the center of the room.

There was a puddle of blood pooling near the drain, every once in a while a drip falling from above.
They looked up.

                   

And then they called back.
"Someone get a ladder"

"We have to cut down a corpse."

Their men worked quickly, and in a moment they had lowered the remains to the floor of the warehouse.
Firebrand strode over to him, their gun aimed at his motionless form.

Vigilante
"Commander," one of the men called, running to Firebrand.   "We've accounted for all the remaining girls. They've all simply been... left here."

Firebrand
"Get them secured," Firebrand called over their mic, their helmet distorting their voice. But there attention was on the body.
A note was pinned to Sklav's bare chest, soaked through with dried blood.

'You made it. 
I hoped you would. 

Shame I heard about this one's failure before you did. 
Consider the girls a reward for cleaning up my mess. 
Maybe next time we'll see each other face to face.

I've been enjoying our game, Firebrand. I can't wait for our next play.

-The Gentleman.'



+++++++++++++++++++++++

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

+++++++++++++++++++++++

Rin was carried into her apartment by Erickson, the two briefly escorted by Ana until they were certain they were secure.  Ana wanted to stay, but needed to move quickly on the information that Winstone had provided them with, and after giving Rin's broken form a hug, departed.

Erickson had gently set her on the bed, then retrieved the comfortable set of clothes that Rin used to wear at night.  He gingerly laid them out next to her, standing a few steps away.

Erickson
"You... You should get comfortable, love."


He said it, but that feeling of helplessness and despair overwhelmed him.

They'd rescued her, they really had.   She was really there.   The girl he loved.  Here, back in their apartment.  Back with him.
But as he looked at her fragile form, it's like even though she was there...
she wasn't there.

..like a star in the night sky.

Rin

She had long since cried herself out.   She sat on the bed, her expression exhausted and sad, her eyes red and dry.

She knew she should feel happy, or relieved, or grateful...

but all she felt was....
...empty.   

After listlessly sitting a moment, she looked to the clothes set out next to her.   She reached over and touched them, resting her hand on them like they were something foreign.

                 
"That's right..."
"these were my clothes."

She regards them a minute, taking them in her hands and looking over them.   
This was a life she used to live.   
This used to be... her.   

But now it all felt so far away.

After a moment her eyes trailed over to Erickson, then up to his face.

Erickson
He was smiling, but his eyes were sad.  His brow furrowed with worry.

Rin
Panic rose in her.  She jerked as if she were in trouble, nervously looking to Erikson.
"S..sorry."

"I'll change right away Sir."


Erickson

"Hey," he said, kneeling down next to her and putting a hand on her arm. 
He could feel her trembling.

"...I'm not Sir. It's me. This isn't some cage... It's your home."

He gave her a soft squeeze.

"Only change if you want."
"Just know that I'm not ordering anything."
"I'm just here for you... Alright?"

His voice was very soft.


Rin

As he knelt there comforting her, she grew still again.   Her breathing returned to normal, but her eyes remained wide.  Uncertain.

"Al... alright." She said, her eyes falling to the clothes on her lap.


Erickson

He touched her hair, soft and fragrant, just like he remembered.


Rin

Instinctually she nuzzled into the touch,
then stopped,
her eyes shifting from grateful to confused and then distressed.


"I c-can't turn it off..."  She said, beginning to shake again

"I can't turn it off..!"  She repeated, burying her face in her hands.

Erickson

"It's alright," he said, in that same soft, even tone,
"You don't have to turn it off now."

"It takes time to heal..."
"Just keep going at a pace you can manage,"

He tucked a finger under her chin.

"...I'm not going away, Rin. I'll be here through it. We all will."
"You... You're our family."


Rin

She makes eye contact with him again, but then her eyes broke away, sliding back down to the floor.

"I... regretted that you met me."
"I thought... it would have been better if you'd never met me."    
She says, the words just coming out of her like a recorder being played back


"I imagined you not knowing what happened, and blaming yourself... and I just couldn't..."

Her lip began to tremble, but she breathed in to keep from losing her composure.

Erickson
"...Never." He said, "I don't regret meeting you.   Not ever.  Not for one instant."

"My only regret is that I didn't listen to you that day.  Didn't listen to what you were trying to tell me."

Rin
"But it was my fault!" she interjected, finally looking up and meeting his gaze...   her own expression racked with guilt.



"You suffered so much...."   she reached out and touched under his eyes  "... because of me!"


"... you...  didn't deserve..."
She gestured to herself, "this...."


Erickson
"Rin..."

"... if I only listened to you... if I'd only noticed how determined you were to help me.   If I'd only realized what you were prepared to do..."   

"If I had, then maybe..."
He looks down, "things would have been different."


Rin
Tears welled up in her eyes again and she said, taking his hands.
"Please don't blame ... don't blame yourself for this."

"It was my decision.  You had tried to warn me."
"And I didn't listen."

"I should have listened to...  you... too."

Erickson
Erickson smiled, wiping away a tear of his own.

"What are we, competing for who's most at fault?"   He said, laughing lightly.
But his expression fell when he saw that she was still looking at him with that same hollow, sad look.

Rin
She looks down at her own hands

"I want to be happy I'm out.   That I'm free. That I'm seeing you."

"I want to be that for you."


"That's what I want to be... for you."


"But I..."
"...."
"... I can't."
"I'm not..."

She begins to tremble.
"I feel like I'm ... like I'm broken.."
"like I'm never going to be o..okay again."

"What if I'm never okay again?"  She asked, looking up with tears plopping on her knees.

Erickson
He reached to touch her hair,
hesitated,
then carefully, gently, began caressing her.

"Don't force it for me, Rin..."
"Don't force it."

"We have time."
"... and I'll be here for you,"
"broken or whole or however you find yourself."

"I'll be here."

Rin

She touched his hand gently, leaning into it, but more genuinely this time.


After sitting that way for several minutes, she continued.   Her eyes unfocused and far off.

"They did things to me Erickson."   
"They did terrible things to me..."

"Even... even..."
"even Win-"

Her voice caught, unable to go on.

Erickson
Erickson didn't interrupt,
He simply continued to caress her
and be present for her.

Rin

Rin continued in a whisper.
"Even... he... did terrible things to me."

"They did them and told me they weren't terrible things.    They asked me to like it."


"So I told them I liked it."

"And now..."

"I don't even know if they were terrible things anymore."


Erickson

"I know," he said, pulling her into a soft embrace.

"... sometimes people do terrible things to us..."

"Terrible, awful things.  So bad that you have to convince yourself they weren't so bad, just to survive." 
"And in doing that you can get lost, thinking that maybe you deserved it.   That you somehow brought it on yourself."


"You don't need to confront all this now.   Or tomorrow.   Or maybe ever.
"But I want you to know that you didn't deserve this Rin."
"Those things that happened, no one deserves to be treated like that."

"And when you're ready to confront just how terrible those things were,
I'll be here for you,
to listen or to carry you."

Rin

She rests there for a long minute, thinking on what Erickson said


"Can you.... do me a favor."


"It's fine if you ... don't want to..."
"...It's... kind of messed up."


Erickson

"If it helps you heal, I'm willing."

"what is it?" he asked, softly rocking her.

Rin

"....."

"Can you just tell me..."

"... who to be for a little while."

"What to wear or... what I should do..."

"You don't have to command me." 
"Just.... decide for me."


"Until I remember who I was..."
"... who I am."


Erickson
"...Right now I want you to be the woman I love."
"And to wear those clothes, because they're comfy and you look cute in them."
"After you take a hot shower."

He kissed her forehead.


Rin

She offered just the slightest hint of a smile, while still looking down at the ground.   "Thanks Mast-" She paused, unsure of what to say.


Erickson

"Erickson."
"Or, 'My handsome boyfriend' will do,"

he smiled gently.


Rin

"You're really more rugged than handsome..."   a wry smile crossed her face


Erickson

Erickson chuckled and kissed her, cupping the back of her head, gently taking her hands in his,
"Hey, the two aren't mutually exclusive..."

He pressed his forehead to hers,

"...Welcome home, love,"

Rin


She let out a little laugh then leaned into him, taking it all in, and whispered.

".... I'm home."



By ClearStyle
